3g-info.title: PC 1203.4a Dismissal
3g-info.text: You are eligible for dismissal under PC 1203.4a.

probation-yes.title: Probation
probation-yes.text: Note: if a person was initially sentenced to some jail time and probation, this is probation. However, if probation was revoked and the person finished their term in prison or jail, it is NOT probation

to-2b-info.title: Penal Code 1203.4 Petition
to-2b-info.text: You are eligible to petition for relief under Penal Code 1203.4

2c.title: Is the conviction on the “always discretionary” list?

discretionary-expungement.title: You are eligible for a Discretionary Expungement under 1203.42.
discretionary-expungement.text: File a CR180, CR181, fee waiver, declaration of MC-31 form, letters of support from community members, and any other county specific forms. You will need to show the court why it should grant your petition.

1c.title: Is it a felony conviction for theft of under $950?

2e.title: You are eligible...
2e.text: ...for a discretionary expungement under 1203.4. File a CR180, CR181, fee waiver, declaration of MC-31 form, letters of support from community members, and any other county specific forms. You will need to show the court why it should grant your petition.

3h-info.title: You are eligible to petition for reduction

3f.title: Did you go to state prison or to county jail for the sentence?
3f.text: Check the excluded conviction list [insert list]

1b.title: Is it a felony conviction for possession of drugs?

3d.title: Is there a prior conviction (prior to the case) for a serious or violent conviction on the serious and violent list?
3d.text: Check the serious and violent list [insert list]

certificate-of-rehabilitation.title: You may be eligible for a Certificate of Rehabilitation
certificate-of-rehabilitation.text: You are not eligible for a dismissal for this conviction, but may be eligible for a Certificate of Rehabilitation [attach information]

2a.title: Is the case eligible for dismissal or reduction under the Penal Code?

to-2e-info.title: Penal Code 17(b)/17(d)(2) Petition
to-2e-info.text: You are eligible to petition for reduction under penal code 17(b) or 17(d)(2)

3a.title: Everything else, other than probation
3a.text: What was the level of conviction? [Flow Chart Outline for CA Criminal Record Expungement]

1a.title: Can the case be reduced by a recent Proposition?

2d.title: Did you complete probation without any additional convictions or probation revocations during probation?

3c.title: Does the case include a serious or violent conviction?
3c.text: Check the serious and violent list [insert list]

3e.title: Does the case include an otherwise excluded conviction?
3e.text: Check the excluded conviction list [insert list]

2b.title: Is the conviction listed on the Wobbler or Wobblett list?

misdemeanor-3g.title: Misdemeanor
misdemeanor-3g.text: [note, if the conviction is eligible for reduction under a proposition, treat it as the reduced level]

mandatory-expungement.title: Mandatory expungement 1203.4
mandatory-expungement.text: You are eligible for a mandatory expungement under 1203.4. File a CR180, CR181, fee waiver, and any other county specific forms, but you are not required to filed a declaration (MC-31)

prop-47-exclusion-list.title: Are you eligible for a Prop 47 Exclusion?

mj-reduction-lists.title: Are you eligible for MJ reduction?

3h.title: Did one year pass, from the date of release or sentencing—whichever happened later-- without another conviction?

3g.title: Is the conviction listed on the Wobblett list?

to-2-info.title: Prop 47 Petition
to-2-info.text: You will file a Prop 47 petition
